summary: Activity not found and activity argument conversion errors are currently marked as non-retryable in the TypeScript SDK, but should be retryable to align with behavior in other Temporal SDKs.
userImpact: Activities fail permanently when encountering not-found or conversion errors instead of being retried according to the retry policy, inconsistent with other SDK implementations.
rootCause: Activity not found and activity arg conversion errors are hardcoded as non-retryable in worker.ts lines 474 and 496, while other SDKs treat them as retryable.
proposedFix: Reclassify activity not found and argument conversion errors as retryable to match behavior in other Temporal SDKs.
resolutionDetails: Issue was addressed by making these error types retryable in the TypeScript SDK to align with other SDK implementations.
keyQuote: this should be a retryable error
